title: ProMedica ForeverFit

content.name: ProMedica ForeverFit
content.description:
ProMedica ForeverFit

Our focus is providing our members with fitness services and a wide range of wellness programs tailored to support healthy aging.

Medically Integrated Fitness Center

As a medically integrated fitness center, ForeverFit has the professional expertise and programming necessary to safely and effectively assist our members to develop, initiate, and maintain an active lifestyle regardless of their current health status. This helps minimize the risk of illness and disease and promotes health and wellness.

How We're Different

  • Our Medical Director provides medical oversight for the facility’s programming in order to maximize the safety of all participants and ensure medically and scientifically sound programs and services.
  • Our professional staff includes fitness team members who have a degree in exercise science and are certified by the National Academy of Sports Medicine.
  • We offer outcome-based fitness programs, such as Script4Fitness, Bridge to Fitness, and Phase 3 Cardiopulmonary Rehab.

Find Us

2865 N. Reynolds Rd.
Toledo, OH 43615

Call (419) 539-0235

Follow us on Facebook

Hours

Monday - Friday: 5:00AM - 8:00PM
Saturday & Sunday: 7:00AM - 2:00PM

Calendars

Group Exercise Calendar

Swim Lane Reservation Schedule

Fitness and Wellness Programs

Group Exercise Classes

We offer classes for all fitness levels:

  • Barre, Cycling, Move & Tone, Boot Camp, Core & More, Group Power and Group Groove.
  • A variety of Yoga classes (Chair Yoga, Yoga Flow, Hath Yoga and Power Yoga).
  • Aqua-Robics (Aqua-Yoga, Gentle Aquatics, Aqua Tabata, Power Aqua).
  • Free Small Group Training Classes (Pilates Reformer and Fascia Release).

ProMedica ForeverFit Fitness App

Enjoy your favorite group exercise classes at home or on the go. The ProMedica ForeverFit app has over 20 different On-Demand Group exercise classes with new classes updated on a monthly basis. Reserve your spot with our quick and easy class booking and swim lane reservations. Log your workouts and food intake and participate in our monthly fitness challenges.

Personal Training

Based on your needs and preferences, we will match you with one of our Exercise Physiologists. Your health goals and medical needs will be integrated into customized, timesaving workout sessions schedule at your convenience. Individual and group training options available.

Pilates Reformer Training

Our professionally trained instructors will guide you through workouts using specialized Pilates Reformer equipment. Pilates promotes core strength, flexibility, strong back and balanced body.

Titleist individualized Golf Fitness Program

Our Golf Fitness program helps you develop a better swing by focusing on the five pillars of the golf swing: flexibility, balance, stabilization, power, muscular strength and endurance.

Wellness Services

We offer a variety of wellness services, including:

  • Massage therapy.
  • Swim lessons.
  • Nutrition counseling, health screenings and cooking demos.
  • Lifelong education opportunities through the Healthy Living Lecture Series on topics such as chronic condition education and caring for aging parents.
​​​​​​​​​​​​

title: ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital

content.name: ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital
content.description:
Our Mission is to improve your health and well-being. For nearly 90 years, ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital has served our friends in Fostoria, Ohio, and the surrounding three counties. Fostoria Community Hospital is a full-service, critical-access hospital (with the exception of obstetrics/labor and delivery) with Joint Commission accreditation.

Cancer Care at Fostoria Community Hospital

Dialysis Center at Fostoria Community Hospital

Our staff. Here, you and your loved ones benefit from the exceptional and dedicated care from our more than 250 active and compassionate local clinical staff members. We’re neighbors caring for our neighbors.

Community involvement. As one of the largest employers in Fostoria, we’re also deeply invested in the economic and social health and wellness of our community. Our involvement includes the Fostoria Chamber of Commerce and the Fostoria Economic Development Corporation. We also provide resources and leadership support / board involvement for local organizations like the United Way of Fostoria and the Fostoria Kiwanis and Rotary Clubs.

Download our community benefit report.

title: ProMedica Headquarters

content.name: ProMedica Headquarters
content.description:
Located in downtown Toledo along Summit and Madison streets, the ProMedica Headquarters campus consists of four buildings and an employee parking garage.

The Junction - 300 N. Summit St.
The Junction office building is part of the ProMedica Headquarters campus. Popular fine dining restaurant The Chop House is located on the first floor.

The Plaza - 300 Madison Ave.
The Plaza office building is part of the ProMedica Headquarters campus. The primary entrance is off Levis Square on Madison; however, you can also enter from Summit St. Starbucks and KeyBank are located on the ground floor.

The Steam Plant - 100 Madison Ave.
The Steam Plant, located on the banks of the Maumee River, houses the company headquarters. Visitors should use the Madison Street entrance, located near the river, just before the flag poles

The Summit Center - 333 N. Summit St.
ProMedica Senior Care offices are the main tenant/occupant in the Summit Center. Popular eatery Focaccia’s is located on the main floor.

The Depot - 202 N. Summit St.
Located at the corner of Jefferson Ave. and Summit St., the Depot is the parking garage for ProMedica's headquarters.

  • Monday - Friday, from 6:30 a.m. - 4:30 p.m., parking in the ProMedica Depot parking garage is limited to downtown employees and employee visitors, downtown YMCA members and Chop House employees.
  • Paid parking is available to the public at the Depot after 4:30 p.m. on weekdays, and on weekends (from 4:30 p.m. on Friday - 6:30 a.m. on Monday).

All non-employee visitors to ProMedica should park at any available public parking location. All visitors need to check in at the front desk to receive a visitor badge. Visitors are also required to have an escort in the building at all times.

Campus Map
For additional information, including addresses, public parking info and entrance locations, download our campus map.

Download Campus Map

title: ProMedica Heart Rhythm Center

content.name: ProMedica Heart Rhythm Center
content.description:
The ProMedica Heart Rhythm Center is a brand new, state-of-the-art facility on the second floor of ProMedica Toledo Hospital. Providing the highest quality of heart rhythm care in Toledo, the center treats simple to complex heart arrhythmias. Our team of electrophysiologists is the largest and most experienced in Toledo. They treat premature ventricular contraction (PVC), supraventricular tachycardia (SVT), atrial fibrillation (AFib), atrial flutter, atrioventricular nodal reentry tachycardia (AVNRT), Wolff-Parkinson-White Syndrome, and ventricular tachycardia (VT).

Take a virtual tour of the ProMedica Heart Rhythm Center

title: ProMedica Hickman Cancer Center - Sylvania

content.name: ProMedica Hickman Cancer Center - Sylvania

address.addressOne:
ProMedica Flower Hospital
5300 Harroun Road. Suite 010

content.description:
ProMedica Hickman Cancer Center resides on the campus of ProMedica Flower Hospital, a Division of ProMedica Toledo Hospital.

Take a virtual tour of our cancer center.

 

ProMedica Hickman Cancer Center - Sylvania is the central hub of our ProMedica Cancer Institute’s services and highly-specialized technologies for cancer care. As an award-winning cancer center, we’re committed to giving you the best possible oncology care here in Toledo, Ohio. From early detection and diagnosis to inpatient and outpatient services, you’ll receive the full spectrum of cancer services at our Hickman Cancer Center.

Cancer Center Treatments and Therapies
As one of the largest radiation providers in the region, we offer highly-advanced cancer treatments and therapies:

  • Cardio-oncology keeps your heart healthy during cancer treatment.
  • Trilogy Linear Accelerator and Stereotactic System delivers higher radiation doses to smaller areas over a shorter time period.
  • HDR (high-dose rate radiation) therapy delivers higher radiation doses directly into certain tumors.
  • Outpatient medical oncology services treat and support people with cancer.
  • Infusion services support medical oncology and non-oncology patients requiring infusions but who don’t require an inpatient stay.
  • Software programs assist in treatment planning and pain management.
  • Eclipse™, a comprehensive treatment planning system that simplifies complex radiation therapy planning for each patient on a case-by-case basis.

Lung Clinic
Get a customized lung cancer treatment plan at this lung specialist-lead clinic. Learn more about the ProMedica Cancer Institute Lung Clinic.

Genetic Testing
If you have multiple cancer risk factors, we offer a genetic testing program led by our dedicated medical director and licensed genetic counselors. Learn more about genetic cancer testing at ProMedica.

Survivor Center
The ProMedica Hickman Cancer Center is home to the Survivor Center, a program for you if you’ve completed active cancer treatment.

Learn more about ProMedica Cancer Institute.

content.name: ProMedica Goerlich Center
content.description:
The ProMedica Goerlich Center provides quality care for individuals with Alzheimer’s and dementia in a calming, familiar and secure environment.

Amenities at the center include:
  • Curio cabinets outside each room for personal mementos, which orient residents
  • Two enclosed, landscaped courtyards for safe outdoor enjoyment 
  • Gazebo and memory garden 
  • Glass enclosed bird aviary 
  • Large multipurpose room in each wing where residents enjoy meals, snacks, and activities 
  • Spacious family room to gather with friends or relatives 
  • Wheelchair-accessible bus for off-site activities 
  • On-site beauty shop (additional fee)

Read more about the ProMedica Goerlich Center

Take a virtual tour of ProMedica Goerlich Center.

title: ProMedica Headquarters

content.name: ProMedica Headquarters
content.description:
Located in downtown Toledo along Summit and Madison streets, the ProMedica Headquarters campus consists of four buildings and an employee parking garage.

The Junction - 300 N. Summit St.
The Junction office building is part of the ProMedica Headquarters campus. Popular fine dining restaurant The Chop House is located on the first floor.

The Plaza - 300 Madison Ave.
The Plaza office building is part of the ProMedica Headquarters campus. The primary entrance is off Levis Square on Madison; however, you can also enter from Summit St. Starbucks and KeyBank are located on the ground floor.

The Steam Plant - 100 Madison Ave.
The Steam Plant, located on the banks of the Maumee River, houses the company headquarters. Visitors should use the Madison Street entrance, located near the river, just before the flag poles

The Summit Center - 333 N. Summit St.
ProMedica Senior Care offices are the main tenant/occupant in the Summit Center. Popular eatery Focaccia’s is located on the main floor.

The Depot - 202 N. Summit St.
Located at the corner of Jefferson Ave. and Summit St., the Depot is the parking garage for ProMedica's headquarters.

  • Monday - Friday, from 6:30 a.m. - 4:30 p.m., parking in the ProMedica Depot parking garage is limited to downtown employees and employee visitors, downtown YMCA members and Chop House employees.
  • Paid parking is available to the public at the Depot after 4:30 p.m. on weekdays, and on weekends (from 4:30 p.m. on Friday - 6:30 a.m. on Monday).

All non-employee visitors to ProMedica should park at any available public parking location. All visitors need to check in at the front desk to receive a visitor badge. Visitors are also required to have an escort in the building at all times.

Campus Map
For additional information, including addresses, public parking info and entrance locations, download our campus map.

Download Campus Map

title: ProMedica Hickman Cancer Center - Sylvania

content.name: ProMedica Hickman Cancer Center - Sylvania

address.addressOne:
ProMedica Flower Hospital
5300 Harroun Road. Suite 010

content.description:
ProMedica Hickman Cancer Center resides on the campus of ProMedica Flower Hospital, a Division of ProMedica Toledo Hospital.

Take a virtual tour of our cancer center.

 

ProMedica Hickman Cancer Center - Sylvania is the central hub of our ProMedica Cancer Institute’s services and highly-specialized technologies for cancer care. As an award-winning cancer center, we’re committed to giving you the best possible oncology care here in Toledo, Ohio. From early detection and diagnosis to inpatient and outpatient services, you’ll receive the full spectrum of cancer services at our Hickman Cancer Center.

Cancer Center Treatments and Therapies
As one of the largest radiation providers in the region, we offer highly-advanced cancer treatments and therapies:

  • Cardio-oncology keeps your heart healthy during cancer treatment.
  • Trilogy Linear Accelerator and Stereotactic System delivers higher radiation doses to smaller areas over a shorter time period.
  • HDR (high-dose rate radiation) therapy delivers higher radiation doses directly into certain tumors.
  • Outpatient medical oncology services treat and support people with cancer.
  • Infusion services support medical oncology and non-oncology patients requiring infusions but who don’t require an inpatient stay.
  • Software programs assist in treatment planning and pain management.
  • Eclipse™, a comprehensive treatment planning system that simplifies complex radiation therapy planning for each patient on a case-by-case basis.

Lung Clinic
Get a customized lung cancer treatment plan at this lung specialist-lead clinic. Learn more about the ProMedica Cancer Institute Lung Clinic.

Genetic Testing
If you have multiple cancer risk factors, we offer a genetic testing program led by our dedicated medical director and licensed genetic counselors. Learn more about genetic cancer testing at ProMedica.

Survivor Center
The ProMedica Hickman Cancer Center is home to the Survivor Center, a program for you if you’ve completed active cancer treatment.

Learn more about ProMedica Cancer Institute.

content.name: ProMedica Goerlich Center
content.description:
The ProMedica Goerlich Center provides quality care for individuals with Alzheimer’s and dementia in a calming, familiar and secure environment.

Amenities at the center include:
  • Curio cabinets outside each room for personal mementos, which orient residents
  • Two enclosed, landscaped courtyards for safe outdoor enjoyment 
  • Gazebo and memory garden 
  • Glass enclosed bird aviary 
  • Large multipurpose room in each wing where residents enjoy meals, snacks, and activities 
  • Spacious family room to gather with friends or relatives 
  • Wheelchair-accessible bus for off-site activities 
  • On-site beauty shop (additional fee)

Read more about the ProMedica Goerlich Center

Take a virtual tour of ProMedica Goerlich Center.

title: ProMedica Headquarters

content.name: ProMedica Headquarters
content.description:
Located in downtown Toledo along Summit and Madison streets, the ProMedica Headquarters campus consists of four buildings and an employee parking garage.

The Junction - 300 N. Summit St.
The Junction office building is part of the ProMedica Headquarters campus. Popular fine dining restaurant The Chop House is located on the first floor.

The Plaza - 300 Madison Ave.
The Plaza office building is part of the ProMedica Headquarters campus. The primary entrance is off Levis Square on Madison; however, you can also enter from Summit St. Starbucks and KeyBank are located on the ground floor.

The Steam Plant - 100 Madison Ave.
The Steam Plant, located on the banks of the Maumee River, houses the company headquarters. Visitors should use the Madison Street entrance, located near the river, just before the flag poles

The Summit Center - 333 N. Summit St.
ProMedica Senior Care offices are the main tenant/occupant in the Summit Center. Popular eatery Focaccia’s is located on the main floor.

The Depot - 202 N. Summit St.
Located at the corner of Jefferson Ave. and Summit St., the Depot is the parking garage for ProMedica's headquarters.

  • Monday - Friday, from 6:30 a.m. - 4:30 p.m., parking in the ProMedica Depot parking garage is limited to downtown employees and employee visitors, downtown YMCA members and Chop House employees.
  • Paid parking is available to the public at the Depot after 4:30 p.m. on weekdays, and on weekends (from 4:30 p.m. on Friday - 6:30 a.m. on Monday).

All non-employee visitors to ProMedica should park at any available public parking location. All visitors need to check in at the front desk to receive a visitor badge. Visitors are also required to have an escort in the building at all times.

Campus Map
For additional information, including addresses, public parking info and entrance locations, download our campus map.

Download Campus Map

The ProMedica Health and Wellness Center brings together a variety of medical services -- from physician offices to diagnostic testing to wellness education to retail -- under one roof. title: ProMedica Heart Failure Clinic - Fremont

content.name: ProMedica Heart Failure Clinic - Fremont
content.description:
Designed for you if you struggle to manage your heart failure. Whether you’ve been discharged from the hospital with heart failure or are already working with your cardiologist, our heart failure staff will:

  • Assess your current health.
  • Review your medications. And make sure they are working for you.
  • Provide you with additional patient education.
  • Address your concerns.

  • Infusion services support medical oncology and non-oncology patients requiring infusions but who don’t require an inpatient stay.
  • Software programs assist in treatment planning and pain management.
  • Eclipse™, a comprehensive treatment planning system that simplifies complex radiation therapy planning for each patient on a case-by-case basis.

Lung Clinic
Get a customized lung cancer treatment plan at this lung specialist-lead clinic. Learn more about the ProMedica Cancer Institute Lung Clinic.

Genetic Testing
If you have multiple cancer risk factors, we offer a genetic testing program led by our dedicated medical director and licensed genetic counselors. Learn more about genetic cancer testing at ProMedica.

Survivor Center
The ProMedica Hickman Cancer Center is home to the Survivor Center, a program for you if you’ve completed active cancer treatment.

Learn more about ProMedica Cancer Institute.

title: ProMedica Memorial Hospital

content.name: ProMedica Memorial Hospital
content.description:
Located in Fremont, Ohio, ProMedica Memorial Hospital has served the citizens of Sandusky County and the adjacent communities since 1918. In fact, our hospital was built with funds raised by members of our community on land donated by the family of former United States President, Rutherford B. Hayes.

Our medical campus features:

  • Advanced Certification as a Primary Stroke Center by the Joint Commission (2020). Take our free stroke risk assessment. You can email Krista Schumm if you have any questions. Click here to visit ProMedica's stroke information page.
  • 43 licensed beds, featuring comprehensive emergency, inpatient and outpatient services.
  • The state-of-the-art Weitzel-Kern Surgery Center, constructed in 2002.
  • The Herbert-Perna Center for Physical Health, constructed in 2007, which offers occupational health services as well as rehabilitation and aquatics centers.
  • A birthing center with six private labor, delivery, recovery, and postpartum rooms, one labor tub, two triage rooms, a nursery with a larger viewing area, one critical resuscitation room, and a NST room, newly re-built in 2019.

Download our community benefit report.

Our History

In 1913, Mary Miller Hayes, daughter-in-law to the late President Rutherford B. Hayes (a Fremont resident), pledged $50,000 of her money, as well as her home, toward the construction of ProMedica Memorial Hospital. This gift, however, could only be realized provided the citizens of Fremont raise an additional $75,000 for the hospital.

The matter rested until 1915 when members of the community went into action. Over the course of six days in October of that year, a whirlwind fundraising campaign known as “Fremont Never Fails” took place. The campaign resulted in $99,672 raised in addition to Mary Miller Hayes' initial $50,000 endowment.

Construction of Memorial Hospital began on August 14, 1916 on land donated by Mary Miller Hayes and her husband, Col. Webb C. Hayes, second son of President Rutherford B. Hayes. The hospital opened its doors on October 4, 1918.

Today, ProMedica Memorial Hospital is a 43 licensed-bed hospital that continues to offer comprehensive, compassionate medical care to the communities we serve.

title: ProMedica Memorial Hospital - Emergency Center 715 S. Taft Ave., Fremont, Ohio (OH), 43420

content.name: ProMedica Memorial Hospital - Emergency Center
content.description:
Experts in emergency medicine quickly get you the medical attention you need and will transfer you to more advanced care, if necessary. To contact the Emergency Center, call 419-334-6621. Call 9-1-1 immediately if you're experiencing a medical emergency.

Learn more about emergency services at ProMedica and download the “Know Where to Go” guide.

The Emergency Center features:

  • 13 private beds

    Along with typical emergencies, we are equipped to treat more critical patients by:

  • Providing immediate diagnosis and treatment for stroke patients (Certified Primary Stroke Center)
  • Employing ICU physicians who are trained in critical care

For our most urgent cases, ProMedica Transportation Network (Air and Mobile) is available to transport patients who require the specialized treatment available at ProMedica Toledo Hospital.

title: ProMedica Memorial Hospital - Labor and Delivery

content.name: ProMedica Memorial Hospital - Labor and Delivery
content.description:
ProMedica Memorial Hospital offers comprehensive maternity services.

Your Growing Family Is Our Priority

At ProMedica Memorial Hospital, we have a team of highly trained physicians and nurses, including lactation experts, to ensure that you receive seamless, high quality care throughout your stay with us.

ProMedica Memorial Hospital birthing center and OB services include:

  • Pre-admission tours
  • Pre-admission information sessions
  • Family and children services coordination
  • A secure unit
  • Board certified lactation consultants for breastfeeding support
  • Individual education
  • Childbirth, sibling and breastfeeding support classes

Our OB unit is equipped with private LDRP rooms, so you can remain in one place throughout your stay.

Take a Virtual Tour

PC users: please use Microsoft Edge or Google Chrome to view the virtual tour. Virtual tour will not load in Internet Explorer

.

At ProMedica Memorial Hospital, every room was designed with patient and family privacy as a top priority. Our birthing suites offer labor, delivery, and recovery all in one private setting. Your baby can remain with you in your room throughout your stay with us. There is even plenty of room for your family support person to stay with you overnight to allow for bonding and special time with the new baby.

As you prepare to go home with your new baby, our staff will provide you with the information you need to care for your baby and yourself. Our nurses are happy to answer your questions and help you anyway that we can.

title: ProMedica Memorial Hospital - Surgery Center - Arthroscopy, Endoscopy, General Surgery, Gynecology, Minimally Invasive Surgery, Ophthalmology, Orthopaedic Surgery, Otolaryngology-Ear Nose Throat, Podiatry - 715 S. Taft Ave., Fremont, Ohio (OH), 43420

content.name: ProMedica Memorial Hospital - Surgery Center
content.description:
We provide surgical services in the family-friendly, state-of-the-art Weitzel-Kern Surgery Center, which is located in ProMedica Memorial Hospital.

From hip-replacement and spine surgeries, to endoscopic and minimally invasive gynecological procedures as well as non-invasive operations, our professionals provide top-notch, compassionate care to patients and their families.

Our physicians are specially trained in many areas of surgery, including:

  • ACL/MCL repair
  • Endoscopy
  • Ear, nose and throat (E.N.T. and Otolaryngology)
  • General surgery
  • Urology
  • Gynecology
  • Opthamology (eye surgery)
  • Orthopaedic surgery (bones and joints)
  • Total joint replacements (hips, knees, shoulders)
  • Podiatry (foot surgery)
  • Minimally-invasive surgery

Our many minimally-invasive procedures allow you to quickly return to your daily life.

Our surgery center was built in 2002 to maximize patient comfort and privacy. Surgery, post-operative recovery, waiting and discharge are all on the same level, minimizing patient transport and maximizing convenience. The patient recovery area is extremely private and comfortable, while the lobby, with its natural lighting and fireplace is an ideal setting for family and friends to await their love ones.

For more information, call ProMedica Memorial Hospital at 419-332-7321.

title: ProMedica Monroe Cancer Center

content.name: ProMedica Monroe Cancer Center
content.description:
The ProMedica Monroe Cancer Center, a Department of ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital, is nationally accredited by the American College of Radiology Accreditation (Radiation Therapy) and the American College of Surgeons Commission on Cancer.

Our center's Cancer Connection program provides cancer support services thanks to funding from United Way of Monroe.

This 13,000 square foot facility opened in 2011. It also includes physician offices and offers laboratory and other oncology-related services.

Find out more about cancer care at ProMedica and ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital.

Take a virtual tour of the Monroe Cancer Center.

Please note: The cancer services offered at ProMedica Monroe Cancer Center are provided by ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital.

  • The Herbert-Perna Center for Physical Health, constructed in 2007, which offers occupational health services as well as rehabilitation and aquatics centers.
  • A birthing center with six private labor, delivery, recovery, and postpartum rooms, one labor tub, two triage rooms, a nursery with a larger viewing area, one critical resuscitation room, and a NST room, newly re-built in 2019.

Download our community benefit report.

Our History

In 1913, Mary Miller Hayes, daughter-in-law to the late President Rutherford B. Hayes (a Fremont resident), pledged $50,000 of her money, as well as her home, toward the construction of ProMedica Memorial Hospital. This gift, however, could only be realized provided the citizens of Fremont raise an additional $75,000 for the hospital.

The matter rested until 1915 when members of the community went into action. Over the course of six days in October of that year, a whirlwind fundraising campaign known as “Fremont Never Fails” took place. The campaign resulted in $99,672 raised in addition to Mary Miller Hayes' initial $50,000 endowment.

Construction of Memorial Hospital began on August 14, 1916 on land donated by Mary Miller Hayes and her husband, Col. Webb C. Hayes, second son of President Rutherford B. Hayes. The hospital opened its doors on October 4, 1918.

Today, ProMedica Memorial Hospital is a 43 licensed-bed hospital that continues to offer comprehensive, compassionate medical care to the communities we serve.

title: ProMedica Memorial Hospital - Emergency Center 715 S. Taft Ave., Fremont, Ohio (OH), 43420

content.name: ProMedica Memorial Hospital - Emergency Center
content.description:
Experts in emergency medicine quickly get you the medical attention you need and will transfer you to more advanced care, if necessary. To contact the Emergency Center, call 419-334-6621. Call 9-1-1 immediately if you're experiencing a medical emergency.

Learn more about emergency services at ProMedica and download the “Know Where to Go” guide.

The Emergency Center features:

  • 13 private beds

    Along with typical emergencies, we are equipped to treat more critical patients by:

  • Providing immediate diagnosis and treatment for stroke patients (Certified Primary Stroke Center)
  • Employing ICU physicians who are trained in critical care

For our most urgent cases, ProMedica Transportation Network (Air and Mobile) is available to transport patients who require the specialized treatment available at ProMedica Toledo Hospital.

title: ProMedica Memorial Hospital - Labor and Delivery

content.name: ProMedica Memorial Hospital - Labor and Delivery
content.description:
ProMedica Memorial Hospital offers comprehensive maternity services.

Your Growing Family Is Our Priority

At ProMedica Memorial Hospital, we have a team of highly trained physicians and nurses, including lactation experts, to ensure that you receive seamless, high quality care throughout your stay with us.

ProMedica Memorial Hospital birthing center and OB services include:

  • Pre-admission tours
  • Pre-admission information sessions
  • Family and children services coordination
  • A secure unit
  • Board certified lactation consultants for breastfeeding support
  • Individual education
  • Childbirth, sibling and breastfeeding support classes

Our OB unit is equipped with private LDRP rooms, so you can remain in one place throughout your stay.

Take a Virtual Tour

PC users: please use Microsoft Edge or Google Chrome to view the virtual tour. Virtual tour will not load in Internet Explorer

.

At ProMedica Memorial Hospital, every room was designed with patient and family privacy as a top priority. Our birthing suites offer labor, delivery, and recovery all in one private setting. Your baby can remain with you in your room throughout your stay with us. There is even plenty of room for your family support person to stay with you overnight to allow for bonding and special time with the new baby.

As you prepare to go home with your new baby, our staff will provide you with the information you need to care for your baby and yourself. Our nurses are happy to answer your questions and help you anyway that we can.

title: ProMedica Memorial Hospital - Surgery Center - Arthroscopy, Endoscopy, General Surgery, Gynecology, Minimally Invasive Surgery, Ophthalmology, Orthopaedic Surgery, Otolaryngology-Ear Nose Throat, Podiatry - 715 S. Taft Ave., Fremont, Ohio (OH), 43420

content.name: ProMedica Memorial Hospital - Surgery Center
content.description:
We provide surgical services in the family-friendly, state-of-the-art Weitzel-Kern Surgery Center, which is located in ProMedica Memorial Hospital.

From hip-replacement and spine surgeries, to endoscopic and minimally invasive gynecological procedures as well as non-invasive operations, our professionals provide top-notch, compassionate care to patients and their families.

Our physicians are specially trained in many areas of surgery, including:

  • ACL/MCL repair
  • Endoscopy
  • Ear, nose and throat (E.N.T. and Otolaryngology)
  • General surgery
  • Urology
  • Gynecology
  • Opthamology (eye surgery)
  • Orthopaedic surgery (bones and joints)
  • Total joint replacements (hips, knees, shoulders)
  • Podiatry (foot surgery)
  • Minimally-invasive surgery

Our many minimally-invasive procedures allow you to quickly return to your daily life.

Our surgery center was built in 2002 to maximize patient comfort and privacy. Surgery, post-operative recovery, waiting and discharge are all on the same level, minimizing patient transport and maximizing convenience. The patient recovery area is extremely private and comfortable, while the lobby, with its natural lighting and fireplace is an ideal setting for family and friends to await their love ones.

For more information, call ProMedica Memorial Hospital at 419-332-7321.

title: ProMedica Monroe Cancer Center

content.name: ProMedica Monroe Cancer Center
content.description:
The ProMedica Monroe Cancer Center, a Department of ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital, is nationally accredited by the American College of Radiology Accreditation (Radiation Therapy) and the American College of Surgeons Commission on Cancer.

Our center's Cancer Connection program provides cancer support services thanks to funding from United Way of Monroe.

This 13,000 square foot facility opened in 2011. It also includes physician offices and offers laboratory and other oncology-related services.

Find out more about cancer care at ProMedica and ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital.

Take a virtual tour of the Monroe Cancer Center.

Please note: The cancer services offered at ProMedica Monroe Cancer Center are provided by ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital.

title: ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital

content.name: ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital
content.description:
ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital offers a broad range of inpatient and outpatient services. Our network of care begins at ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital and extends throughout the ProMedica system in southern Michigan and Ohio.

Quality and patient safety are hallmarks of ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital's mission. A national leader in treatment of heart attack, congestive heart failure, pneumonia and surgical care, ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital is also a pacesetter in Michigan for obstetrics, emergency care, intensive care, controlling infections and organ donation.

title: ProMedica Memorial Hospital

content.name: ProMedica Memorial Hospital
content.description:
Located in Fremont, Ohio, ProMedica Memorial Hospital has served the citizens of Sandusky County and the adjacent communities since 1918. In fact, our hospital was built with funds raised by members of our community on land donated by the family of former United States President, Rutherford B. Hayes.

Our medical campus features:

  • Advanced Certification as a Primary Stroke Center by the Joint Commission (2020). Take our free stroke risk assessment. You can email Krista Schumm if you have any questions. Click here to visit ProMedica's stroke information page.
  • 43 licensed beds, featuring comprehensive emergency, inpatient and outpatient services.
  • The state-of-the-art Weitzel-Kern Surgery Center, constructed in 2002.
  • The Herbert-Perna Center for Physical Health, constructed in 2007, which offers occupational health services as well as rehabilitation and aquatics centers.
  • A birthing center with six private labor, delivery, recovery, and postpartum rooms, one labor tub, two triage rooms, a nursery with a larger viewing area, one critical resuscitation room, and a NST room, newly re-built in 2019.

Download our community benefit report.

Our History

In 1913, Mary Miller Hayes, daughter-in-law to the late President Rutherford B. Hayes (a Fremont resident), pledged $50,000 of her money, as well as her home, toward the construction of ProMedica Memorial Hospital. This gift, however, could only be realized provided the citizens of Fremont raise an additional $75,000 for the hospital.

The matter rested until 1915 when members of the community went into action. Over the course of six days in October of that year, a whirlwind fundraising campaign known as “Fremont Never Fails” took place. The campaign resulted in $99,672 raised in addition to Mary Miller Hayes' initial $50,000 endowment.

Construction of Memorial Hospital began on August 14, 1916 on land donated by Mary Miller Hayes and her husband, Col. Webb C. Hayes, second son of President Rutherford B. Hayes. The hospital opened its doors on October 4, 1918.

Today, ProMedica Memorial Hospital is a 43 licensed-bed hospital that continues to offer comprehensive, compassionate medical care to the communities we serve.

Our surgery center was built in 2002 to maximize patient comfort and privacy. The patient recovery area is extremely private and comfortable, while the lobby, with its natural lighting and fireplace is an ideal setting for family and friends to await their love ones.

title: ProMedica Memorial Hospital

content.name: ProMedica Memorial Hospital
content.description:
Located in Fremont, Ohio, ProMedica Memorial Hospital has served the citizens of Sandusky County and the adjacent communities since 1918. In fact, our hospital was built with funds raised by members of our community on land donated by the family of former United States President, Rutherford B. Hayes.

Our medical campus features:

  • Advanced Certification as a Primary Stroke Center by the Joint Commission (2020). Take our free stroke risk assessment. You can email Krista Schumm if you have any questions. Click here to visit ProMedica's stroke information page.
  • 43 licensed beds, featuring comprehensive emergency, inpatient and outpatient services.
  • The state-of-the-art Weitzel-Kern Surgery Center, constructed in 2002.
  • The Herbert-Perna Center for Physical Health, constructed in 2007, which offers occupational health services as well as rehabilitation and aquatics centers.
  • A birthing center with six private labor, delivery, recovery, and postpartum rooms, one labor tub, two triage rooms, a nursery with a larger viewing area, one critical resuscitation room, and a NST room, newly re-built in 2019.

Download our community benefit report.

Our History

In 1913, Mary Miller Hayes, daughter-in-law to the late President Rutherford B. Hayes (a Fremont resident), pledged $50,000 of her money, as well as her home, toward the construction of ProMedica Memorial Hospital. This gift, however, could only be realized provided the citizens of Fremont raise an additional $75,000 for the hospital.

The matter rested until 1915 when members of the community went into action. Over the course of six days in October of that year, a whirlwind fundraising campaign known as “Fremont Never Fails” took place. The campaign resulted in $99,672 raised in addition to Mary Miller Hayes' initial $50,000 endowment.

Construction of Memorial Hospital began on August 14, 1916 on land donated by Mary Miller Hayes and her husband, Col. Webb C. Hayes, second son of President Rutherford B. Hayes. The hospital opened its doors on October 4, 1918.

Today, ProMedica Memorial Hospital is a 43 licensed-bed hospital that continues to offer comprehensive, compassionate medical care to the communities we serve.

title: ProMedica Memorial Hospital - Emergency Center 715 S. Taft Ave., Fremont, Ohio (OH), 43420

content.name: ProMedica Memorial Hospital - Emergency Center
content.description:
Experts in emergency medicine quickly get you the medical attention you need and will transfer you to more advanced care, if necessary. To contact the Emergency Center, call 419-334-6621. Call 9-1-1 immediately if you're experiencing a medical emergency.

Learn more about emergency services at ProMedica and download the “Know Where to Go” guide.

The Emergency Center features:

  • 13 private beds

    Along with typical emergencies, we are equipped to treat more critical patients by:

  • Providing immediate diagnosis and treatment for stroke patients (Certified Primary Stroke Center)
  • Employing ICU physicians who are trained in critical care

For our most urgent cases, ProMedica Transportation Network (Air and Mobile) is available to transport patients who require the specialized treatment available at ProMedica Toledo Hospital.

title: ProMedica Memorial Hospital - Labor and Delivery

content.name: ProMedica Memorial Hospital - Labor and Delivery
content.description:
ProMedica Memorial Hospital offers comprehensive maternity services.

Your Growing Family Is Our Priority

At ProMedica Memorial Hospital, we have a team of highly trained physicians and nurses, including lactation experts, to ensure that you receive seamless, high quality care throughout your stay with us.

ProMedica Memorial Hospital birthing center and OB services include:

  • Pre-admission tours
  • Pre-admission information sessions
  • Family and children services coordination
  • A secure unit
  • Board certified lactation consultants for breastfeeding support
  • Individual education
  • Childbirth, sibling and breastfeeding support classes

Our OB unit is equipped with private LDRP rooms, so you can remain in one place throughout your stay.

Take a Virtual Tour

PC users: please use Microsoft Edge or Google Chrome to view the virtual tour. Virtual tour will not load in Internet Explorer

.

At ProMedica Memorial Hospital, every room was designed with patient and family privacy as a top priority. Our birthing suites offer labor, delivery, and recovery all in one private setting. Your baby can remain with you in your room throughout your stay with us. There is even plenty of room for your family support person to stay with you overnight to allow for bonding and special time with the new baby.

As you prepare to go home with your new baby, our staff will provide you with the information you need to care for your baby and yourself. Our nurses are happy to answer your questions and help you anyway that we can.

title: ProMedica Memorial Hospital

content.name: ProMedica Memorial Hospital
content.description:
Located in Fremont, Ohio, ProMedica Memorial Hospital has served the citizens of Sandusky County and the adjacent communities since 1918. In fact, our hospital was built with funds raised by members of our community on land donated by the family of former United States President, Rutherford B. Hayes.

Our medical campus features:

  • Advanced Certification as a Primary Stroke Center by the Joint Commission (2020). Take our free stroke risk assessment. You can email Krista Schumm if you have any questions. Click here to visit ProMedica's stroke information page.
  • 43 licensed beds, featuring comprehensive emergency, inpatient and outpatient services.
  • The state-of-the-art Weitzel-Kern Surgery Center, constructed in 2002.
  • The Herbert-Perna Center for Physical Health, constructed in 2007, which offers occupational health services as well as rehabilitation and aquatics centers.
  • A birthing center with six private labor, delivery, recovery, and postpartum rooms, one labor tub, two triage rooms, a nursery with a larger viewing area, one critical resuscitation room, and a NST room, newly re-built in 2019.

Download our community benefit report.

Our History

In 1913, Mary Miller Hayes, daughter-in-law to the late President Rutherford B. Hayes (a Fremont resident), pledged $50,000 of her money, as well as her home, toward the construction of ProMedica Memorial Hospital. This gift, however, could only be realized provided the citizens of Fremont raise an additional $75,000 for the hospital.

The matter rested until 1915 when members of the community went into action. Over the course of six days in October of that year, a whirlwind fundraising campaign known as “Fremont Never Fails” took place. The campaign resulted in $99,672 raised in addition to Mary Miller Hayes' initial $50,000 endowment.

Construction of Memorial Hospital began on August 14, 1916 on land donated by Mary Miller Hayes and her husband, Col. Webb C. Hayes, second son of President Rutherford B. Hayes. The hospital opened its doors on October 4, 1918.

Today, ProMedica Memorial Hospital is a 43 licensed-bed hospital that continues to offer comprehensive, compassionate medical care to the communities we serve.

title: ProMedica Memorial Hospital - Emergency Center 715 S. Taft Ave., Fremont, Ohio (OH), 43420

content.name: ProMedica Memorial Hospital - Emergency Center
content.description:
Experts in emergency medicine quickly get you the medical attention you need and will transfer you to more advanced care, if necessary. To contact the Emergency Center, call 419-334-6621. Call 9-1-1 immediately if you're experiencing a medical emergency.

Learn more about emergency services at ProMedica and download the “Know Where to Go” guide.

The Emergency Center features:

  • 13 private beds

    Along with typical emergencies, we are equipped to treat more critical patients by:

  • Providing immediate diagnosis and treatment for stroke patients (Certified Primary Stroke Center)
  • Employing ICU physicians who are trained in critical care

For our most urgent cases, ProMedica Transportation Network (Air and Mobile) is available to transport patients who require the specialized treatment available at ProMedica Toledo Hospital.

title: ProMedica Memorial Hospital - Labor and Delivery

content.name: ProMedica Memorial Hospital - Labor and Delivery
content.description:
ProMedica Memorial Hospital offers comprehensive maternity services.

Your Growing Family Is Our Priority

At ProMedica Memorial Hospital, we have a team of highly trained physicians and nurses, including lactation experts, to ensure that you receive seamless, high quality care throughout your stay with us.

ProMedica Memorial Hospital birthing center and OB services include:

  • Pre-admission tours
  • Pre-admission information sessions
  • Family and children services coordination
  • A secure unit
  • Board certified lactation consultants for breastfeeding support
  • Individual education
  • Childbirth, sibling and breastfeeding support classes

Our OB unit is equipped with private LDRP rooms, so you can remain in one place throughout your stay.

Take a Virtual Tour

PC users: please use Microsoft Edge or Google Chrome to view the virtual tour. Virtual tour will not load in Internet Explorer

.

At ProMedica Memorial Hospital, every room was designed with patient and family privacy as a top priority. Our birthing suites offer labor, delivery, and recovery all in one private setting. Your baby can remain with you in your room throughout your stay with us. There is even plenty of room for your family support person to stay with you overnight to allow for bonding and special time with the new baby.

As you prepare to go home with your new baby, our staff will provide you with the information you need to care for your baby and yourself. Our nurses are happy to answer your questions and help you anyway that we can.

State-of-the-Art MRI Services Now Available at ProMedica Memorial Hospital

ProMedica is proud to introduce our new 1.5T MRI system that automatically adjusts to patient biovariability. This new technology produces high quality images that provide clinical confidence without the need for rescans. Additionally, the machine expands our capabilities and improves patient comfort with free-breathing exams, more space inside the machine, and faster scan times.

title: ProMedica Memorial Hospital - Surgery Center - Arthroscopy, Endoscopy, General Surgery, Gynecology, Minimally Invasive Surgery, Ophthalmology, Orthopaedic Surgery, Otolaryngology-Ear Nose Throat, Podiatry - 715 S. Taft Ave., Fremont, Ohio (OH), 43420

content.name: ProMedica Memorial Hospital - Surgery Center
content.description:
We provide surgical services in the family-friendly, state-of-the-art Weitzel-Kern Surgery Center, which is located in ProMedica Memorial Hospital.

From hip-replacement and spine surgeries, to endoscopic and minimally invasive gynecological procedures as well as non-invasive operations, our professionals provide top-notch, compassionate care to patients and their families.

Our physicians are specially trained in many areas of surgery, including:

  • ACL/MCL repair
  • Endoscopy
  • Ear, nose and throat (E.N.T. and Otolaryngology)
  • General surgery
  • Urology
  • Gynecology
  • Opthamology (eye surgery)
  • Orthopaedic surgery (bones and joints)
  • Total joint replacements (hips, knees, shoulders)
  • Podiatry (foot surgery)
  • Minimally-invasive surgery

Our many minimally-invasive procedures allow you to quickly return to your daily life.

Our surgery center was built in 2002 to maximize patient comfort and privacy. Surgery, post-operative recovery, waiting and discharge are all on the same level, minimizing patient transport and maximizing convenience. The patient recovery area is extremely private and comfortable, while the lobby, with its natural lighting and fireplace is an ideal setting for family and friends to await their love ones.

For more information, call ProMedica Memorial Hospital at 419-332-7321.

title: ProMedica Monroe Cancer Center

content.name: ProMedica Monroe Cancer Center
content.description:
The ProMedica Monroe Cancer Center, a Department of ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital, is nationally accredited by the American College of Radiology Accreditation (Radiation Therapy) and the American College of Surgeons Commission on Cancer.

Our center's Cancer Connection program provides cancer support services thanks to funding from United Way of Monroe.

This 13,000 square foot facility opened in 2011. It also includes physician offices and offers laboratory and other oncology-related services.

Find out more about cancer care at ProMedica and ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital.

Take a virtual tour of the Monroe Cancer Center.

Please note: The cancer services offered at ProMedica Monroe Cancer Center are provided by ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital.

title: ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital

content.name: ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital
content.description:
ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital offers a broad range of inpatient and outpatient services. Our network of care begins at ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital and extends throughout the ProMedica system in southern Michigan and Ohio.

Quality and patient safety are hallmarks of ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital's mission. A national leader in treatment of heart attack, congestive heart failure, pneumonia and surgical care, ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital is also a pacesetter in Michigan for obstetrics, emergency care, intensive care, controlling infections and organ donation.

content.name: ProMedica Physicians Obstetrics and Gynecology - Oregon
content.description:
ProMedica’s Certified Nurse Midwives provide an array of women’s care services. While midwives are probably best known for their care of women during pregnancy and childbirth, they are also experts in women’s health throughout the lifespan - from adolescence through menopause.

Midwives offer specialized care, intended to foster a holistic approach to health and well-being, by providing choices of healthcare options that help their patients make informed decisions.

Call 419-690-8880 today to schedule.

Learn more about women's services at Bay Park Hospital.

ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Childrenâs Hospital - Pediatric Sedation Infusion and Vascular Access 2142 N Cove Blvd, Toledo, Ohio (OH), 43606

content.name: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital - Pediatric Sedation Infusion and Vascular Access
content.description:
The Sedation Infusion and Vascular Access Center is located on the fourth floor of ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital. The outpatient center was updated in January 2022 and consists of one bronchoscopy room, six private infusion rooms, one treatment and one procedure room.

Services at this Location

The patients cared for range from new born to 17 years of age, and are seeking procedural sedation for minor tests and procedures, recurring infusions, and vascular access health care needs, such as, but not limited to:

  • Sedation for minor procedures/testing- MRI, CT, Nuc Med, Interventional Radiology, Gastrics, Audiology, EEG, Echocardiogram, PICC Insertion, and Lumbar Punctures
  • Pediatric Intravenous device placement for Radiology, Hematology/Oncology, and hospitalized patients experiencing difficult vascular access.
  • Ultrasound guided vascular access- lab draws, peripheral IVs, Midlines, and PICC line insertion.
  • Central line declotting and troubleshooting
  • Intravenous infusions, enzyme replacement therapy, and immunoglobulin therapy
  • Stimulation testing
  • Bronchoscopy and Upper Airway evaluations- provide nursing care and assist for pediatric/neonatal non-sedated and general anesthesia bronchoscopy
  • Urinary catheter placement for fluoroscopy and nuclear medicine studies

title: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital
content.name: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital
content.description:
ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital, formerly ProMedica Toledo Children's Hospital, is a 169-bed facility in Toledo, Ohio established in 1993, and has grown to be the region’s leading pediatric care facility. We offer a full spectrum of medical services to meet the unique needs of children from birth through adolescence.

  • We're accredited by the Joint Commission. We strive to meet the highest national standards for safety and quality of care and are committed to continually improving patient care.
  • We’re the region’s largest Level II pediatric trauma center, providing high quality trauma care for patients during any life emergency.
  • The Hillabrand Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU) is a Level III 72-bed unit providing care for premature babies as early as 22 weeks gestation and as small as 400 grams (14 oz). Our NICU has individual patient rooms designed to mimic the sheltered environment of a mother's womb.
  • Our pediatric cancer specialists treat patients in our state-of-the-art, yet youthful and whimsical, Debbie Brass Children's Cancer Center.
  • We're the first dual-certified asthma program for treating both inpatient and outpatients by the Joint Commission in Ohio.

title: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital - Emergency Center

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital - Emergency Center
content.name: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital - Emergency Center
content.description:
The Region’s Only Dedicated Children’s Emergency Center

After all, kids are special. And that’s just the way we treat them. At ProMedica Ebeid's Children's Hospital, formerly ProMedica Toledo Children's Hospital, Emergency Center:

  • Features nine child-friendly pediatric care rooms.
  • Is served by pediatric and emergency physicians 24 hours a day, seven days a week.
  • Is staffed by professionals who are specially trained to treat children's medical needs and have pediatric advanced life support (PALS) certification.
  • Is furnished with kid-sized treatment and diagnostic equipment.

When do you need the ER? At times, it's difficult to decide whether to take your child to the emergency room, an urgent care facility or to your child's doctor. Our “When Do I Need the ER?” has helpful tips.

If you think your child is experiencing an emergency, don’t hesitate. Call 9-1-1.

title: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center
content.name: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center
content.description:
The Finnegan Family Autism Center works to set standards to diagnose autism early, offer options for individualized interventions and provide continued care and support. The center is home to the Autism Early Learning Program, as well as Avenues for Autism and iTaalk. The University of Toledo Occupational Therapy Department supports open play sessions in our indoor and outdoor play/sensory areas.

Autism Early Learning Program

When your child is diagnosed with autism spectrum disorder, you want solutions and services that address their unique needs.

Located in the ProMedica Finnegan Family Autism Center, the Autism Early Learning Program offers early intensive behavioral intervention services for children with autism utilizing Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA). The program operates year-around with options for full day and partial day services from the age of diagnosis through 6 years.

Each child’s program is individualized with intervention focusing on building skills in the following areas: communication, behavior, play, socialization, adaptive, and developmentally appropriate skills acquisition. Services are implemented in classroom or therapy settings with 1:1 ratios and options for group learning as appropriate. Dependent on a child’s skills and needs, group learning settings with a behavior analytic approach are also available. Parent training and participation are integral to every child’s success and are mandatory across all programs.

Services at the Autism Early Learning Program are provided by board certified behavior analysts (BCBA) and center-based behavior technicians. Additional therapy services such as speech and language therapy can also be accessed at the center. All services are provided in accordance with Ohio licensure laws.

Enrolling in the Autism Early Learning Program

If you think your child would benefit from the Autism Early Learning Program, our staff can assess your child’s unique needs to determine how best we can support your family.

If we believe our program will help you, we’ll arrange an appointment with one of our team members. If we don’t think the program is a good match for your situation, we’ll recommend other options or provide referrals. Call us to enroll at 419-291-7080.

Parent Involvement

Our goal is to provide the best services possible for children with autism. We encourage you to be an active participant in your child’s - intervention. This includes:

  • Daily written correspondence with your child’s team.
  • Home visits twice a year by your child’s behavior analyst.
  • Parent training participation as indicated in your child’s individualized treatment plan. This may include observation of your child interacting with their team at the center and you demonstrating and practicing skills with your child.

Insurance Coverage and Costs

The Autism Early Learning Program accepts most insurance plans. Potential costs would be dependent upon your insurance plan. Please check with your health plan for specific coverage information.

We are also an approved Ohio Department of Education Autism Scholarship provider. Outside agencies and school districts may also contract for program services.

Operational Hours

ProMedica’s Autism Early Learning Program does operate year-round. Our offices are open 8 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., Monday through Friday. ABA services typically take place between the hours of 8:30 a.m. – 4 p.m.

Understanding Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA)

Our Autism Early Learning Program team at the Finnegan Family Autism Center is trained in applied behavior analysis (ABA), a science that uses behavioral techniques to teach children basic and complex skills. It works by reinforcing appropriate behavior while decreasing or eliminating interfering behavior. Opportunities for success are built into the program and adjustments are made as children progress, helping them function better in the world.

The goal of ABA is to go from a 1:1, highly structured teaching environment to a less structured teaching environment in a small group. Then, to go to a naturalistic, large group general education setting.

While using the principles of ABA, we systematically teach and reinforce small, measurable and attainable units of targeted skills. Every skill (small or complex) is broken down into small steps. Each step is practiced until success is achieved.

If we believe our program will help you, we’ll arrange an appointment with one of our team members. If we don’t think the program is a good match for your situation, we’ll recommend other options or provide referrals. Call us to enroll at 419-291-7080.

Parent Involvement

Our goal is to provide the best services possible for children with autism. We encourage you to be an active participant in your child’s - intervention. This includes:

  • Daily written correspondence with your child’s team.
  • Home visits twice a year by your child’s behavior analyst.
  • Parent training participation as indicated in your child’s individualized treatment plan. This may include observation of your child interacting with their team at the center and you demonstrating and practicing skills with your child.

Insurance Coverage and Costs

The Autism Early Learning Program accepts most insurance plans. Potential costs would be dependent upon your insurance plan. Please check with your health plan for specific coverage information.

We are also an approved Ohio Department of Education Autism Scholarship provider. Outside agencies and school districts may also contract for program services.

Operational Hours

ProMedica’s Autism Early Learning Program does operate year-round. Our offices are open 8 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., Monday through Friday. ABA services typically take place between the hours of 8:30 a.m. – 4 p.m.

Understanding Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA)

Our Autism Early Learning Program team at the Finnegan Family Autism Center is trained in applied behavior analysis (ABA), a science that uses behavioral techniques to teach children basic and complex skills. It works by reinforcing appropriate behavior while decreasing or eliminating interfering behavior. Opportunities for success are built into the program and adjustments are made as children progress, helping them function better in the world.

The goal of ABA is to go from a 1:1, highly structured teaching environment to a less structured teaching environment in a small group. Then, to go to a naturalistic, large group general education setting.

While using the principles of ABA, we systematically teach and reinforce small, measurable and attainable units of targeted skills. Every skill (small or complex) is broken down into small steps. Each step is practiced until success is achieved.

ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Childrenâs Hospital - Pediatric Sedation Infusion and Vascular Access 2142 N Cove Blvd, Toledo, Ohio (OH), 43606

content.name: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital - Pediatric Sedation Infusion and Vascular Access
content.description:
The Sedation Infusion and Vascular Access Center is located on the fourth floor of ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital. The outpatient center was updated in January 2022 and consists of one bronchoscopy room, six private infusion rooms, one treatment and one procedure room.

Services at this Location

The patients cared for range from new born to 17 years of age, and are seeking procedural sedation for minor tests and procedures, recurring infusions, and vascular access health care needs, such as, but not limited to:

  • Sedation for minor procedures/testing- MRI, CT, Nuc Med, Interventional Radiology, Gastrics, Audiology, EEG, Echocardiogram, PICC Insertion, and Lumbar Punctures
  • Pediatric Intravenous device placement for Radiology, Hematology/Oncology, and hospitalized patients experiencing difficult vascular access.
  • Ultrasound guided vascular access- lab draws, peripheral IVs, Midlines, and PICC line insertion.
  • Central line declotting and troubleshooting
  • Intravenous infusions, enzyme replacement therapy, and immunoglobulin therapy
  • Stimulation testing
  • Bronchoscopy and Upper Airway evaluations- provide nursing care and assist for pediatric/neonatal non-sedated and general anesthesia bronchoscopy
  • Urinary catheter placement for fluoroscopy and nuclear medicine studies

title: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital
content.name: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital
content.description:
ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital, formerly ProMedica Toledo Children's Hospital, is a 169-bed facility in Toledo, Ohio established in 1993, and has grown to be the region’s leading pediatric care facility. We offer a full spectrum of medical services to meet the unique needs of children from birth through adolescence.

  • We're accredited by the Joint Commission. We strive to meet the highest national standards for safety and quality of care and are committed to continually improving patient care.
  • We’re the region’s largest Level II pediatric trauma center, providing high quality trauma care for patients during any life emergency.
  • The Hillabrand Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU) is a Level III 72-bed unit providing care for premature babies as early as 22 weeks gestation and as small as 400 grams (14 oz). Our NICU has individual patient rooms designed to mimic the sheltered environment of a mother's womb.
  • Our pediatric cancer specialists treat patients in our state-of-the-art, yet youthful and whimsical, Debbie Brass Children's Cancer Center.
  • We're the first dual-certified asthma program for treating both inpatient and outpatients by the Joint Commission in Ohio.

title: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital - Emergency Center

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital - Emergency Center
content.name: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital - Emergency Center
content.description:
The Region’s Only Dedicated Children’s Emergency Center

After all, kids are special. And that’s just the way we treat them. At ProMedica Ebeid's Children's Hospital, formerly ProMedica Toledo Children's Hospital, Emergency Center:

  • Features nine child-friendly pediatric care rooms.
  • Is served by pediatric and emergency physicians 24 hours a day, seven days a week.
  • Is staffed by professionals who are specially trained to treat children's medical needs and have pediatric advanced life support (PALS) certification.
  • Is furnished with kid-sized treatment and diagnostic equipment.

When do you need the ER? At times, it's difficult to decide whether to take your child to the emergency room, an urgent care facility or to your child's doctor. Our “When Do I Need the ER?” has helpful tips.

If you think your child is experiencing an emergency, don’t hesitate. Call 9-1-1.

title: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center
content.name: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center
content.description:
The Finnegan Family Autism Center works to set standards to diagnose autism early, offer options for individualized interventions and provide continued care and support. The center is home to the Autism Early Learning Program, as well as Avenues for Autism and iTaalk. The University of Toledo Occupational Therapy Department supports open play sessions in our indoor and outdoor play/sensory areas.

Autism Early Learning Program

When your child is diagnosed with autism spectrum disorder, you want solutions and services that address their unique needs.

Located in the ProMedica Finnegan Family Autism Center, the Autism Early Learning Program offers early intensive behavioral intervention services for children with autism utilizing Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA). The program operates year-around with options for full day and partial day services from the age of diagnosis through 6 years.

Each child’s program is individualized with intervention focusing on building skills in the following areas: communication, behavior, play, socialization, adaptive, and developmentally appropriate skills acquisition. Services are implemented in classroom or therapy settings with 1:1 ratios and options for group learning as appropriate. Dependent on a child’s skills and needs, group learning settings with a behavior analytic approach are also available. Parent training and participation are integral to every child’s success and are mandatory across all programs.

Services at the Autism Early Learning Program are provided by board certified behavior analysts (BCBA) and center-based behavior technicians. Additional therapy services such as speech and language therapy can also be accessed at the center. All services are provided in accordance with Ohio licensure laws.

Enrolling in the Autism Early Learning Program

If you think your child would benefit from the Autism Early Learning Program, our staff can assess your child’s unique needs to determine how best we can support your family.

If we believe our program will help you, we’ll arrange an appointment with one of our team members. If we don’t think the program is a good match for your situation, we’ll recommend other options or provide referrals. Call us to enroll at 419-291-7080.

Parent Involvement

Our goal is to provide the best services possible for children with autism. We encourage you to be an active participant in your child’s - intervention. This includes:

  • Daily written correspondence with your child’s team.
  • Home visits twice a year by your child’s behavior analyst.
  • Parent training participation as indicated in your child’s individualized treatment plan. This may include observation of your child interacting with their team at the center and you demonstrating and practicing skills with your child.

Insurance Coverage and Costs

The Autism Early Learning Program accepts most insurance plans. Potential costs would be dependent upon your insurance plan. Please check with your health plan for specific coverage information.

We are also an approved Ohio Department of Education Autism Scholarship provider. Outside agencies and school districts may also contract for program services.

Operational Hours

ProMedica’s Autism Early Learning Program does operate year-round. Our offices are open 8 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., Monday through Friday. ABA services typically take place between the hours of 8:30 a.m. – 4 p.m.

Understanding Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA)

Our Autism Early Learning Program team at the Finnegan Family Autism Center is trained in applied behavior analysis (ABA), a science that uses behavioral techniques to teach children basic and complex skills. It works by reinforcing appropriate behavior while decreasing or eliminating interfering behavior. Opportunities for success are built into the program and adjustments are made as children progress, helping them function better in the world.

The goal of ABA is to go from a 1:1, highly structured teaching environment to a less structured teaching environment in a small group. Then, to go to a naturalistic, large group general education setting.

While using the principles of ABA, we systematically teach and reinforce small, measurable and attainable units of targeted skills. Every skill (small or complex) is broken down into small steps. Each step is practiced until success is achieved.

ProMedica Spine Care - Spine Care - 2130 W. Central Ave., Toledo, Ohio (OH), 43606

content.name: ProMedica Spine Care
content.description:
Spine Clinic in Toledo

ProMedica Spine Care on W. Central Ave. is located in the ProMedica Neurosciences Center adjacent to the campus of ProMedica Toledo Hospital.

The spine clinic is a fast-track option for patients who want prompt access to a convenient, comprehensive evaluation of their back pain, spine pain or neck pain.

At our spine clinic, patients receive a back or neck pain assessment and exam, and a recommendation for a spine treatment plan.

Our spine clinic is open to all patients.

  • No referral or prior testing is necessary for an appointment at our spine clinic.
  • We accept patients who are already in treatment or want a second opinion (no provider referral is required).
  • Patients with new or existing injuries and patients with chronic or acute or intermittent back, neck or spine issues are welcome.
  • ProMedica Spine Care also has a spine clinic in Perrysburg at Levis Commons.

Learn more about spine care at ProMedica

title: ProMedica Spine Care - Fostoria - Back Care, Spine Care - 501 Van Buren St. | Suite 202, Fostoria, Ohio (OH), 44830

content.name: ProMedica Spine Care - Fostoria
content.description:
Spine Clinic in Fostoria

ProMedica Spine Care in Fostoria is located inside ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital, inside suite 202.

The spine care clinic focuses exclusively on spinal, neck and back treatments.

Patients will receive prompt access to a convenient, comprehensive evaluation of their back, neck pain or spine pain, with a quality diagnosis, while creating a customized care plan.

Our spine clinic in Fostoria is open to all patients.

      
    • Walk-in without an appointment! If patients wish to schedule an appointment, they may call 419-578-7141, or speak with their primary care physician to obtain a referral.
    • Patients can receive a CT (computed tomography) scan, a discogram, an EMG (electromyography), an MRI (magnetic resonance imaging), a myelogram, or an X-ray.
    • Patients with new or pre-existing injuries and patients with chronic or acute back, neck or spine pain are welcome.

    Learn more about spine care at ProMedica

title: ProMedica Toledo Hospital

content.name: ProMedica Toledo Hospital
content.description:
50 Best Hospitals in America! We're proud to be named one of Healthgrades® America’s 50 Best Hospitals™ for three consecutive years (2020 – 2022). This award recognizes the top 1 percent of hospitals in the nation for exhibiting clinical excellence for at least four consecutive years.

Proudly located in West Toledo, ProMedica Toledo Hospital:

  • Is the largest acute care facility in the Toledo area.
  • Serves a 27-county area in northwest Ohio and southeast Michigan.
  • Houses 794 hospital beds.
  • Employs more than 4,800 health care professionals.
  • Is comprised of more than 1,000 primary care and specialty doctors, the largest board-certified medical staff in our entire area.

What does this mean to you? You have access to award winning, world-class care right here in Toledo, with a deep commitment to your health and the heart of our community.

Our history informs our future. Our story began in 1874 with a group of non-denominational Christian women who vowed to care for the poor and the sick. They established the original Toledo Hospital in a small home near Bancroft and Cherry Streets.

This commitment still stands today. ProMedica Toledo Hospital continues this dedication to the health of our own northwest Ohio community while attaining the highest national health care industry standards.

Learn more about the legacy of ProMedica Toledo Hospital.

ProMedica Toledo Hospital - Emergency Center 2142 N. Cove Blvd., Toledo, Ohio (OH), 43606

content.name: ProMedica Toledo Hospital - Emergency Center
content.description:
We’re your Level I Trauma Center.

Severe injuries, the kind that threaten life or limb, require swift and specialized treatment. We’re one of only 11 Level I Trauma Centers in all of Ohio. Being awarded the highest national recognition that a trauma center can obtain confirms that you’re in a place equipped to handle the most critical injuries. Among other requirements for a Level I Trauma Center, we offer 24/7 access to medical staff and surgeons who are specially trained in trauma care.

We’re the only hospital in our region with a cardiologist available 24 hours a day, seven days a week. Commended for our expertise and commitment for emergency cardiac care, ProMedica Toledo Hospital is also certified as an Accredited Chest Pain Center by the Society for Chest Pain Centers.

Get state-of-the-art emergency services at ProMedica Toledo Hospital. Our technologically advanced tools include:

  • Computerized axial tomography (CAT scan)
  • Updated imaging services

Call 9-1-1 if you’re experiencing a medical emergency. To connect with our emergency services, call 419-291-4101.

Learn more about emergency services at ProMedica and download the “Know Where to Go” guide.

title: ProMedica Toledo Hospital - Labor and Delivery

content.name: ProMedica Toledo Hospital - Labor and Delivery
content.description:
The ProMedica Toledo Hospital Labor and Delivery includes a level 3 perinatal unit for high risk births and high risk pregnancies.

Labor and Delivery

  • Spacious labor, delivery, and recovery suites, and postpartum rooms
  • A Level III regional perinatal unit which cares for high-risk pregnancies with the highest level of accreditation possible
  • Postpartum support groups

Take a Virtual Tour

PC users: please use Microsoft Edge or Google Chrome to view the virtual tour. Virtual tour will not load in Internet Explorer.

Preparation for Parenthood

  • Childbirth class
  • Lactation center services
  • Big Brother and Big Sister Class
  • Baby care class
  • Breastfeeding Class
  • Infant Safety and CPR Class
  • Prenatal water aerobics class
  • Breastfeeding for working mothers class

Call 419-291-5666 to register for classes or inquire about services. Register early in your pregnancy and plan to start class by week 32. Written confirmation, which will include the locations of your classes, will be mailed to you.

Download our preparation for parenthood programs and services guide.

Download our preparation for parenthood calendar.

Lactation Center

Arrange for a personal session with our lactation consultants by calling the center at 419-291-5666. Or call the breastfeeding WARMLINE at 419-291-4577.

ProMedica Spine Care - Spine Care - 2130 W. Central Ave., Toledo, Ohio (OH), 43606

content.name: ProMedica Spine Care
content.description:
Spine Clinic in Toledo

ProMedica Spine Care on W. Central Ave. is located in the ProMedica Neurosciences Center adjacent to the campus of ProMedica Toledo Hospital.

The spine clinic is a fast-track option for patients who want prompt access to a convenient, comprehensive evaluation of their back pain, spine pain or neck pain.

At our spine clinic, patients receive a back or neck pain assessment and exam, and a recommendation for a spine treatment plan.

Our spine clinic is open to all patients.

  • No referral or prior testing is necessary for an appointment at our spine clinic.
  • We accept patients who are already in treatment or want a second opinion (no provider referral is required).
  • Patients with new or existing injuries and patients with chronic or acute or intermittent back, neck or spine issues are welcome.
  • ProMedica Spine Care also has a spine clinic in Perrysburg at Levis Commons.

Learn more about spine care at ProMedica
